learning_outcomes.description: Read and write all Korean characters and understand basic Korean sentences which are related to the coverage of the course and concerning yourself, you family and your friends, daily lives
Develop insights into cultural diversity and differences between Korean culture and society and those of the students
Understand written Korean within the range of topics studied
Perform basic tasks and functions in Korean

assessments.due_date:
9/12/2025 5:00 pm

Note: The take-home assignment will be released at 8:00 am on Tuesday Week 2 via Blackboard. Students must submit the assignment by 5:00 pm on Tuesday of Week 3.
assessments.task_description:
General information

  • Students are required to complete the Take-home assignment and submit it on Blackboard by the due date.
  • The assignment may assess the following skills:
  • Vocabulary recognition
  • Grammar
  • Dialogue completion
  • Producing appropriate expressions based on the information cues provided
  • Preparation guidelines and marking criteria will be available on Blackboard.

Guidelines for using generative AI (Gen AI) or machine translation tools in assignments

  • If you do not use Gen AI or machine translation tools (e.g., ChatGPT, Google Gemini, etc.) in your assignments, you must acknowledge this on the provided cover sheets and submit the cover sheets with your assignment.
  • If you do use Gen AI or machine translation tools, you must acknowledge their use on the cover sheets—including where you have directly quoted or paraphrased generative AI content, or used tools to summarise readings, brainstorm ideas, plan your process, or for editing or proofreading—and submit the cover sheets with your assignment. In addition, you must submit both your original draft and the version that has been processed using GenAI or machine translation tools.
  • The cover sheet should include the following information:
  • The Gen AI system or machine translation tool(s) used (e.g., Copilot, ChatGPT, Claude, Google Gemini)
  • A description of how the tool was utilised (e.g., editing, correcting, translating, planning, brainstorming)
  • The specific prompt(s) used
  • The part, section, or page of the assignment where the tool was applied
  • The date of use
  • To assist you, cover sheet template will be made available on Blackboard prior to the assessment. For further details, please refer to this link: https://guides.library.uq.edu.au/referencing/generative-ai-tools-assignments.

Statement on AI & MT

  • This task has been designed to be challenging, authentic and complex. Whilst students may use AI and/or MT technologies, successful completion of assessment in this course will require students to critically engage in specific contexts and tasks for which artificial intelligence will provide only limited support and guidance. A failure to reference generative AI or MT use may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct. To pass this assessment, students will be required to demonstrate detailed comprehension of their written submission independent of AI and MT tools.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.due_date:
17/12/2025 2:45 pm

The written exam will be held from 1:00 pm to 2:45 pm AEST (90 minutes for the exam and 15 minutes for the submission of answer sheets) on Wednesday in Week 4.
assessments.task_description:
General information

  • This exam consists of multiple-choice questions and handwriting tasks.
  • The exam content will be released on Blackboard at the designated time on the exam day.
  • Separate answer sheets will be available on Blackboard prior to the exam. You must either print the answer sheets and bring them with you on the exam day, or download them to a handwriting-compatible tablet (e.g., an iPad).
  • For multiple-choice questions, you must select the correct option and record the corresponding number. For handwriting tasks, you must handwrite your answers in full on the answer sheets and submit them via Turnitin on Blackboard. If you are using a device, you are still required to handwrite your answers on the answer sheets during the exam.
  • Throughout the entire duration of the exam, you must have your camera on in the Zoom meeting room (the virtual background function on Zoom is not permitted). You must also keep your Zoom camera on while uploading the handwritten answer sheets.
  • If you encounter any difficulties uploading the answer sheets, please email the lecturer immediately.
  • Ensure that the handwritten answer sheets are clearly legible (i.e., make sure the scan is clear). Any illegible submissions will require a resubmission. 
  • Preparation guidelines and marking criteria will be available on Blackboard.

Gen AI & Machine Translation (MT) Statement

  • This assessment task evaluates students' abilities, skills, and knowledge without the aid of generative Artificial Intelligence (AI) or Machine Translation (MT). Students are advised that the use of AI or MT technologies to develop responses is strictly prohibited and may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
assessments.submission_guidelines: You may be able to defer this exam.

assessments.late_submission: Exams submitted after the end of the submission time will incur a late penalty.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to defer this exam.

assessments.due_date:
23/12/2025 3:25 pm

The written exam will be held from 1:00 pm to 3:25 pm AEST on Tuesday in Week 5 (including 10 minutes of reading time, 120 minutes for the exam, and 15 minutes for the submission of answer sheets).
assessments.task_description:
General information

  • This final examination may include selecting correct particles/markers, gap-filling tasks, reading comprehension tasks, writing appropriate responses to questions in Korean, translation tasks (Korean to English/English to Korean), writing a passage in Korean, constructing conversations based on given scenarios, and choosing the correct grammatical points.
  • The exam paper will be released on Blackboard on the day of the exam.
  • You must handwrite your answers on the separate answer sheets and submit them via Turnitin on Blackboard.
  • The separate answer sheets will be made available on Blackboard prior to the exam. You must print out the answer sheets and bring them on the exam day to complete by hand. Alternatively, you may download the answer sheets to a tablet that supports handwriting functions, such as an iPad, and complete them by hand on the device during the exam.
  • Throughout the entire duration of the exam, you must keep your camera on in the Zoom meeting room (the virtual background function on Zoom is not permitted). You must also keep your Zoom camera on while uploading the handwritten answer sheets.
  • If you encounter any difficulties uploading the answer sheets, please email the lecturer immediately.
  • Ensure that the handwritten answer sheets are clearly legible (i.e., make sure the scan is clear). Any illegible submissions will require resubmission.
  • Preparation guidelines and marking criteria will be available on Blackboard.

Gen AI & Machine Translation (MT) Statement

  • This assessment task evaluates students' abilities, skills, and knowledge without the aid of generative Artificial Intelligence (AI) or Machine Translation (MT). Students are advised that the use of AI or MT technologies to develop responses is strictly prohibited and may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
